sen.j: 日下部 定好（くさかべ さだよし）は、戦国時代 (日本)の徳川氏家臣。
sen.e: Sadayoshi KUSAKABE was a retainer of the TOKUGAWA clan during the Sengoku Period.
Sadayoshi KUSAKABE was a retainer of the Tokugawa clan in the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States).
sen.cmt: 用語集に従い、「戦国時代」の説明を加えました。
sen.e: Sadayoshi KUSAKABE was a retainer of the Tokugawa clan in the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States).

sen.j: 織田信長に仕えていたが、当時同僚だった豊臣秀吉と諍いをおこし出奔する。
sen.e: Although he was serving Nobunaga ODA, he had a dispute with Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, who was his co-worker at the time and ran away.
Although he had been serving Nobunaga ODA, he ran away after he had a dispute with his co-worker Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI.
sen.cmt: 文の構造を変えました。
sen.e: Although he had been serving Nobunaga ODA, he ran away after he had a dispute with his co-worker Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI.

sen.j: 後に徳川家康に仕官し、成瀬正一 (戦国武将)と共に長篠の戦い、高天神城の戦いで活躍する。
sen.e: Later, he served Ieyasu TOKUGAWA and played an active role in the Battle of Nagashino and the Battle of the Takatenjin-jo Castle together with Masakazu NARUSE (Sengoku Busho [Japanese military commandar during the Sengoku Period])

sen.j: 徳川家康が甲斐国を支配すると奉行に任ぜられる。
sen.e: He was appointed the Bugyo (magistrate) when Ieyasu TOKUGAWA ruled Kai Province.

sen.j: 関東討入後は武蔵国鉢形城の代官に任ぜられ、関ヶ原の戦いの時には徳川秀忠の旗奉行として従軍。
sen.e: After the raid on the Kanto region, he was appointed the Daikan (deputy official) of the Hachigata-jo Castle in the Musashi Province and joined the force led by Hidetada TOKUGAWA as the Hatabugyo (flag magistrate) during the Battle of Sekigahara.

sen.j: そのまま伏見城留守居役に任ぜられる。
sen.e: He was appointed the Rusuiyaku (person representing the master during his absence) of the Fushimi-jo Castle.
